import React from 'react'; import { Link } from 'react-router-dom'; import { useLanguage } from '../contexts/LanguageContext'; import { Clock, MapPin, Phone, Heart, Users, BookOpen, Calendar, Star, Cross } from 'lucide-react'; import './Home.css'; const Home: React.FC = () => { const { t } = useLanguage(); return (
{/* Hero Section */}

{t('home.welcome')}

{t('home.subtitle')}

{t('home.visit_us')} Calendar
{/* Spiritual Content Section */}

Daily Spiritual Nourishment

{/* Theme of the Year */}

Theme of the Year 2024

"Walking in Faith, Growing in Love"

"And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love." - 1 Corinthians 13:13

This year, we focus on deepening our faith journey while expanding our capacity to love God and neighbor. Through prayer, service, and community, we grow together as the Body of Christ.

{/* Daily Reading */}

Today's Reading

{new Date().toLocaleDateString('en-US', { weekday: 'long', month: 'long', day: 'numeric' })}
First Reading: Isaiah 55:10-11
Psalm: Psalm 65:10-14
Gospel: Matthew 13:1-23

"The word of God will not return empty, but will accomplish what I please and succeed in what I sent it to do."

Read Full Liturgy
{/* Saint of the Day */}

Saint of the Day

St. Thérèse of Lisieux
The Little Flower
1873 - 1897

Known for her "Little Way" of spiritual childhood, St. Thérèse taught that sanctity is achievable by all through simple acts of love and trust in God.

"I will spend my heaven doing good on earth."
Prayer: St. Thérèse, help us to trust in God's love and find holiness in the ordinary moments of life.
{/* Quick Info Section - Mass Times & Contact */}
{/* Mass Times Card */}

{t('home.mass_times')}

Parish Choir
Youth Group
Community Outreach
Sunday Mass
View Parish News
{/* About Us Section */}

About St. Patrick's

Our History

St. Patrick's Catholic Church has been serving the Makokoba community in Bulawayo for over 50 years, providing spiritual guidance and community support to generations of faithful parishioners.

Our Mission

To serve God and our community through worship, outreach, and social justice, embracing both English and IsiNdebele speaking parishioners in unity and love.

{/* Diaspora Corner */}

{t('community.diaspora')}

{t('community.diaspora_desc')}

UK Parishioners: Christmas greetings from the Makokoba community
South Africa: Prayer intentions from home parish
Stay Connected
); }; export default Home;
